bibl.title: Sterling P. White v. John Cody. Summons
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p:
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON,
County of Spokane } SS.

Territory of Washington
Plaintiff
vs.
Sterling P. White
Defendant }
In the District Court of the Territory of Washington and for the First Fourth Judicial District thereof, holding terms at Cheney, Spokane County, in said Territory.
To the Sheriff of Lincoln County, Greeting:

IN THE NAME OF THE UNITED STATES, You are hereby commanded to summon F. M. Spencer and J.H. Hart to be and appear before the District Court apear at the Court House, in Cheney, in said County, on the forthwith day of April A.D. 1885, at o'clock, M., to there give evidence in the above entitled cause on the part of said Defendant.
Witness the Hon. George Turner Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Territory, and Judge of said Court, and the Seal thereof affixed, this 20 day of April A.D. 1885

Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk.
By R. Strobach Deputy.
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, County of Spokane Lincoln } SS.
I hereby certify that I served the within Subpoena on the within named witness by reading the same to them in said County, on this 23d day of April A.D. 1885

Jno Cody Sheriff
By J. N. Friedlander, Deputy.
div1.ab: In the District Court of the Territory of Washington, and for the First Judicial District thereof, holding Terms at Cheney, Spokane County, in said Territory
Returned and Filed this 28 day of, April A.D. 1885
Kate W. Feuerbach Clerk. By. R. Strobach Deputy.
div1.p:
Sheriff's Fees
Serving 2 names at 40 80
Mileage 144 miles at 10 1440
Total, ---$1520 1580
